data.title: Order of Charles De Lint Books
data.meta_description: This is the Order of Charles De Lint Books in both chronological order and publication order. List verified daily and newest books added immediately.
data.text:
Charles de Lint is a Canadian author of fantasy novels. He writes the Newford series (among other series). He has also written horror novels as Samuel M. Key. Charles writes books for adults, young adults and children. He spent his late 20s and early 30s working in a record store, then playing with a Celtic band during the weekends. He began writing in 1983 and has been writing full-time since that time. Aside from writing, he is also a musician, songwriter, artist, performer and folklorist. Charles lives in Ottawa, Ontario with his wife (and manager), MaryAnn Harris.

Charles de Lint made his debut as a published author in 1984 with the novels The Riddle of the Wren and Moonheart. Below is a list of Charles de Lint’s books in order of when they were first released:

Publication Order of Moonheart Books

Publication Order of Cerin Songweaver Books

(with Richard A. Lupoff, Philip Jose Farmer, Robin Wayne Bailey)

Notes: Angel of Darkness, From a Whisper to a Scream, and I’ll Be Watching You were written as Samuel M. Key. The Wild Wood was written with Brian Froud.

If You Like Charles De Lint Books, You’ll Love…

Fritz Leiber

Lois McMaster Bujold

Sharon Lee

Charles de Lint Synopses: In Riddle of the Wren by Charles de Lint, Minda is trapped inside a dark nightmare and makes a journey to another world to confront Ildran the Dream-master and try to save the Lord of the Moors.

Mulengro is a standalone novel by Charles de Lint. A series of strange murders have baffled the police – but each one is somehow connected with the city’s elusive Gypsy community. The police are searching for a human killer, but the Romany know better. They know the name of the darkness that hunts them down, one by one: Mulengro.

In Yarrow by Charles de Lint, Cat Midhir has written several popular fantasy novels. But what her fans didn’t know was that her Otherworld was not any sort of fantasy. Then, one night, a thief stole her dreams. Since then, she’s been trapped in the everyday. And the Others are looking for her…
